intro: Retinispora filiformis, commonly known as the threadleaf retinispora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in countries like Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Retinispora filiformis produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, humid environments such as forest understories.
